gw.plugin.personaldata

Interface PersonalDataDestruction

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin, java.rmi.Remote

    public interface PersonalDataDestruction
extends com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin
    This plugin is called once per root and additionally for any entities that may need to be destroyed but are not part of any entity graph instance, and once per request to purge a user (UserContact instance).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Allocate and return an extended @{link PurgeContext}.

      Notify the data protection officer when a purge could not be completed when the root PersonalDataDisposition is MUST_DESTROY.
      void notifyExternalSystemsRequestProcessed(PersonalDataDestructionRequester requester)

      Post-purge extension hook.

      PersonalDataDisposition shouldDestroyUser(UserContact userContact)
      Decide disposition of target UserContact bean representing an employee.

    • Method Detail

      • shouldDestroyRoot

        PersonalDataDisposition shouldDestroyRoot(DestructionRootPinnable root,
                                          java.util.Collection<DestructionRootPinnable> descendants,
                                          DestructionRootPinnable origin)
        Called once for each root to decide disposition of the entity instance graph rooted at specified root.
        Parameters:
        root - a root entity instance discovered from traversing the entity graph beginning at origin
        descendants - DestructionRootPinnable descendants of the root
        origin - the bean that was the starting point of the purge request. May be same as root (e.g., contact) but will usually be different
        Returns:
        disposition of the instance graph

      • shouldDestroyUser

        PersonalDataDisposition shouldDestroyUser(UserContact userContact)
        Decide disposition of target UserContact bean representing an employee.
        Parameters:
        userContact - the UserContact bean that is to be destroyed
        Returns:
        disposition of the target UserContact bean

      • notifyDataProtectionOfficer

        void notifyDataProtectionOfficer(DestructionRootPinnable root,
                                 java.lang.String title,
                                 java.lang.String message,
                                 java.util.Date dateOfError)
        Notify the data protection officer when a purge could not be completed when the root PersonalDataDisposition is MUST_DESTROY.
        Parameters:
        root - root entity that is requested to be destroyed
        title - title of message for compliance officer notification
        message - details about the error or what could not be destroyed and why
        dateOfError - time at which the error was reported

      • notifyExternalSystemsRequestProcessed

        void notifyExternalSystemsRequestProcessed(PersonalDataDestructionRequester requester)
        Notify the external system that this contact with AddressBookUID has been destroyed.
        Parameters:
        requester - The external system who requested the AddressBookUID or publicID to be destroyed

      • createContext

        PersonalDataPurgeContext createContext(PersonalDataPurgeContext context)
        Allocate and return an extended @{link PurgeContext}.
        Parameters:
        context - The system context used to construct an extended context.
        Returns:
        The system purge context or an extended purge context.

      • prepareForPurge

        void prepareForPurge(PersonalDataPurgeContext context)
        Pre-purge extension hook. Other than logging or gathering statistics, Guidewire recommends that only a minimal amount of changes occur in the prepareForPurge method.
        Parameters:
        context - specifies what is to be destroyed

      • postPurge

        void postPurge(PersonalDataPurgeContext context)
        Post-purge extension hook.
        Parameters:
        context - from prepareForPurge

      • getDestroyer

        PersonalDataDestroyer getDestroyer()
        Returns:
        PersonalDataDestroyer knows how to destroy the necessary roots
